intro: Euphrasia odontites proles serotinus, commonly known as the late-flowering eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom later in the growing season. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in alpine meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia species are known for their medicinal properties, and this particular subspecies is used in traditional herbal remedies for eye conditions.
